page.title: 16Linnel Mill by Alison Lambie
page.content: We went to the Linnels on Tuesday.It is a beautiful old house with a lovely big garden.Mr.Charlton told us about the house when we went in.The old mill worked on water from the mill race, from the dam across Devil's Water.First the Linnels was a cottage then it was a pub.There was a battle of Hexham on Mr.Charlton's land, between Lancaster and York.Queen Margaret had to escape with her little son and she met up with a robber who helped her.The mill was for the farmers round about to grind their corn into meal.The mill is very old and very dark.We don't know when the mill was built but the house was built in the 1800s.The house was the first in this area to have electricty from the turbo generator in the mill.Linnel Bridge is a lovely old narrow bridge built in 1531 in reign of Q.Eliz.1.
